intro: Stimpsonia, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant belonging to the Campanulaceae family. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, yellow or golden flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Stimpsonia has lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged in a basal rosette. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
